<s>[INST] George Washington was the first president of the United States. [/INST] Yes, George Washington was indeed the first president of the United States. He held office from 1789 to 1797 and is often referred to as the "Father of His Country" due to his crucial role in the founding of the nation and his leadership during its early years.</s>

<s>[INST] John Adams and Thomas Jefferson both died on July 4, 1826.
 [/INST] That's correct. Both John Adams and Thomas Jefferson, the second and third presidents of the United States respectively, died on the same day, which was July 4, 1826. This date is especially significant as it marked the 50th anniversary of the Declaration of Independence. Their simultaneous deaths on this particular date added to the lore of U.S. history, symbolizing the end of an era and the profound impact these Founding Fathers had on the nation's foundation.</s>
